findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors, but this check is redundant since Solidity version 0.8.0 and later revert on overflow and underflow.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages. These error messages do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone. It's important to carefully test and debug assembly code to ensure that it is correct and does not contain any errors.
